Legal_Issue: Sufficiency of reasons and residence requirement compliance
Outcome: Appeal allowed, matter referred back for redetermination
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under Federal Courts Rules
Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistencies in travel records and lack of documentation
Legal_Provision: Residence requirement: three years in four years preceding application
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet statutory residence requirement
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Gaps in physical presence and unaddressed evidence
Application_Error: Insufficient reasoning, failure to specify test applied (physical presence vs. intention)
Evidence_Ignored: Inconsistencies in travel history, undocumented periods of residence
Application_Factor: Residency calculation and credibility of applicant's claims
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and factual basis for approval
Outcome_of_Review: Referred back for reassessment by another citizenship judge
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient justification and unresolved evidentiary gaps
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to address material gaps in evidence
Credibility_Issues: Unclear intent and unverified periods of residence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Minister challenged approval based on errors in fact and law
Omission_Type: Failure to apply or state correct legal test
